intro: Dicranolepis usambarica, commonly known as the Usambara fern, is a species of fern native to the Eastern Arc Mountains of Tanzania. It belongs to the family Polypodiaceae and is characterized by its delicate, creeping rhizomes and finely divided fronds. The plant typically grows in shaded, moist environments such as forest undergrowth. Its leaves are usually bright green and have a feathery appearance, contributing to its ornamental value. Dicranolepis usambarica is of interest to botanists due to its unique ecological adaptations and limited distribution.
